name: Network Signal Processing
description: Sector template for network physical layer signal processing patents including equalization, modulation, and SerDes.
contextDescription: Network signal processing patents cover physical layer communication. Key areas include equalization (H04L25), modulation (H04L27), clock recovery (H04L7), and channel coding (H03M13). High-value targets include SerDes IP vendors (Synopsys, Cadence, Rambus), PHY vendors (Marvell, Broadcom, Microchip), and all high-speed interface implementers. Critical for PCIe, Ethernet, USB, and data center interconnects.
scoringGuidance: High-speed SerDes patents (112G, 224G) target data center and AI interconnects.
Equalization patents (FFE, DFE, CTLE) are essential for all high-speed links.
Clock and data recovery (CDR) patents are in every serial link.
Forward error correction (FEC) patents enable longer reaches and higher speeds.

questions.question: What signal processing function does this cover (equalization, modulation, CDR, FEC)?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the signal processing function and its universality.

questions.question: What data rates is this applicable to? Score: 1-3 for legacy (<10G), 4-6 for current (25-56G), 7-10 for cutting-edge (112G+).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Higher data rates command higher value. Assess applicable speeds.

questions.question: Is this relevant to SerDes IP? Targets Synopsys, Cadence, Rambus, Alphawave.
questions.reasoningPrompt: SerDes IP is a concentrated, high-margin market.

questions.question: Which interface standards apply (PCIe, Ethernet, USB, DDR, CXL)? More standards = broader applicability.
